segment.source: Describes the best practices, location, values, policy management, and security considerations for the Lock pages in memory security policy setting.
segment.target: Describes the best practices, location, values, policy management, and security considerations for the Lock pages in memory security policy setting.

segment.source: Describes the best practices, location, values, policy management, and security considerations for the Lock pages in memory security policy setting.
segment.target: Describes the best practices, location, values, policy management, and security considerations for the Lock pages in memory security policy setting.

segment.source: This policy setting determines which accounts can use a process to keep data in physical memory, which prevents the computer from paging the data to virtual memory on a disk.
segment.target: This policy setting determines which accounts can use a process to keep data in physical memory, which prevents the computer from paging the data to virtual memory on a disk.

segment.source: Normally, an application running on Windows can negotiate for more physical memory, and in response to the request, the application begins to move the data from RAM (such as the data cache) to a disk.
segment.target: Normally, an application running on Windows can negotiate for more physical memory, and in response to the request, the application begins to move the data from RAM (such as the data cache) to a disk.

segment.source: When the pageable memory is moved to a disk, more RAM is free for the operating system to use.
segment.target: When the pageable memory is moved to a disk, more RAM is free for the operating system to use.

segment.source: Enabling this policy setting for a specific account (a user account or a process account for an application) prevents paging of the data.
segment.target: Enabling this policy setting for a specific account (a user account or a process account for an application) prevents paging of the data.

segment.source: Thereby, the amount of memory that Windows can reclaim under pressure is limited.
segment.target: Thereby, the amount of memory that Windows can reclaim under pressure is limited.

segment.source: This could lead to performance degradation.
segment.target: This could lead to performance degradation.

segment.source: Note: By configuring this policy setting, the performance of the Windows operating system will differ depending on if applications are running on 32-bit or 64-bit systems, and if they are virtualized images.
segment.target: Note: By configuring this policy setting, the performance of the Windows operating system will differ depending on if applications are running on 32-bit or 64-bit systems, and if they are virtualized images.

segment.source: Performance will also differ between earlier and later versions of the Windows operating system.
segment.target: Performance will also differ between earlier and later versions of the Windows operating system.

segment.source: Best practices are dependent on the platform architecture and the applications running on those platforms.
segment.target: Best practices are dependent on the platform architecture and the applications running on those platforms.

segment.source: Computer ConfigurationWindows SettingsSecurity SettingsLocal PoliciesUser Rights Assignment
segment.target: Computer ConfigurationWindows SettingsSecurity SettingsLocal PoliciesUser Rights Assignment

segment.source: The following table lists the actual and effective default policy values for the most recent supported versions of Windows.
segment.target: The following table lists the actual and effective default policy values for the most recent supported versions of Windows.

segment.source: Default values are also listed on the policy’s property page.
segment.target: Default values are also listed on the policy’s property page.

segment.source: This section describes features, tools, and guidance to help you manage this policy.
segment.target: This section describes features, tools, and guidance to help you manage this policy.

segment.source: A restart of the computer is not required for this policy setting to be effective.
segment.target: A restart of the computer is not required for this policy setting to be effective.

segment.source: Any change to the user rights assignment for an account becomes effective the next time the owner of the account logs on.
segment.target: Any change to the user rights assignment for an account becomes effective the next time the owner of the account logs on.

segment.source: Settings are applied in the following order through a Group Policy Object (GPO), which will overwrite settings on the local computer at the next Group Policy update:
segment.target: Settings are applied in the following order through a Group Policy Object (GPO), which will overwrite settings on the local computer at the next Group Policy update:

segment.source: When a local setting is greyed out, it indicates that a GPO currently controls that setting.
segment.target: When a local setting is greyed out, it indicates that a GPO currently controls that setting.

segment.source: This section describes how an attacker might exploit a feature or its configuration, how to implement the countermeasure, and the possible negative consequences of countermeasure implementation.
segment.target: This section describes how an attacker might exploit a feature or its configuration, how to implement the countermeasure, and the possible negative consequences of countermeasure implementation.

segment.source: Users with the Lock pages in memory user right could assign physical memory to several processes, which could leave little or no RAM for other processes and result in a denial-of-service condition.
segment.target: Users with the Lock pages in memory user right could assign physical memory to several processes, which could leave little or no RAM for other processes and result in a denial-of-service condition.

segment.source: Do not assign the Lock pages in memory user right to any accounts.
segment.target: Do not assign the Lock pages in memory user right to any accounts.

segment.source: Not defined is the default configuration.
segment.target: Not defined is the default configuration.
